column1: '''Fortinbras Took II''' was the twenty-ninth [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]].
Fortinbras was the son of [[Isumbras Took IV
column4: 1314}}, and had one son, [[Ferumbras Took III
column5: Ferumbras III]], born two years later.<ref name="L214">{{L

column1: Fortinbras became Thain after his father's death in {{SR
column2: 1339}}.<ref name="Took"/> It was during his rule when his distant kinsman, [[Bilbo Baggins]], left for his [[Quest for Erebor

column1: He was Thain for 41 years, and after his death in {{SR
column3: 1380}} at the age of 102 he was succeeded as Thain by his son Ferumbras; however, in accordance with Took tradition, Lalia continued to be head of the family until her death in {{SR

column2: Fortinbras]] is the name of two characters in Shakespeare's ''[[wikipedia:Hamlet
column3: Hamlet]]''. It is French for "strong in arms".<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>
